intro: Adipera corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white or pale pink. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems. Adipera corymbosa thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes.
